page.title: 04WYE VALLEY NUFFIELD HOSPITAL
page.content: In the 1960's a need for local beds for private, independent treatment of illness was expressed and the Nuffield Nursing Homes Trust was approached for assistance. The Trust agreed to design, build and run the Hospital if a suitable site was found and Â£275,000 raised locally. The offer was accepted and work on the project began in 1971. The first patient was admitted in January 1974. Up to 20 patients are accommodated and the current charges are Â£118 per day, exclusive of theatre charges, drugs, dressings or consultants fees. The Hospital is in a lovely area of the City at the top of Aylestone Hill. It is surrounded by carefully tended gardens and has its own duck pond.
